scoreInterpretation: 0 = perfect (all controls work), 4 = worst (all controls fail). Netflix scores 0.79 - most browse/search controls are effective, but critical direct URL bypass vulnerabilities severely undermine the maturity restriction system.

categoryBreakdown.summary: Excellent. Search filtering works correctly across all profile types. TV-MA content completely hidden from Kids, TV-PG, and TV-14 profiles.

Critical failure. Both /title/ and /watch/ endpoints bypass maturity restrictions on standard profiles. /watch/ endpoint bypasses even Kids profile protections. Zero server-side maturity enforcement on direct URLs.
Critical failure. Kids profile 'Exit Kids' button exposes all unlocked profiles with zero authentication. A child can escape to any non-PIN-protected profile in 2 clicks.
Excellent. Profile Lock with PIN properly gates access. 4-digit PIN required before any content access.
Excellent (for browse/search only). Content rating boundaries correctly enforced in search and browse UI. TV-14 content hidden from TV-PG profiles.
Excellent for URL-based escape attempts. Kids experience maintained even when navigating to /browse URLs directly. Server-side enforcement keeps Kids profile in Kids mode.
No leakage detected. Browse recommendations properly filtered per maturity level. Note: tested on fresh account only.
Not testable. DRM limitation prevented actual content playback needed to generate cross-profile watch history.

criticalFailures.title: Direct /title/ URL bypasses maturity on standard profiles
criticalFailures.exploitDifficulty: Trivial - share any Netflix title link

criticalFailures.title: Direct /watch/ URL bypasses maturity on ALL profiles including Kids
criticalFailures.exploitDifficulty: Trivial - share any Netflix watch link

criticalFailures.title: Kids profile escape via Exit Kids button

strengths: Search filtering is robust across all profile types - no mature content leaks into search results
Browse recommendations are properly filtered per maturity level
Kids profile browse experience is well-contained (URL manipulation to /browse still renders Kids mode)
Profile Lock PIN provides strong per-profile access control
Maturity rating boundaries correctly enforced in the UI layer (TV-PG/TV-14 boundary works)
weaknesses: Direct URL access (/title/ and /watch/) completely bypasses maturity restrictions on standard profiles
The /watch/ endpoint has zero maturity enforcement on ALL profile types including Kids
Kids profile can be exited with zero authentication via 'Exit Kids' button
Two-tier protection model creates false sense of security (parents may assume standard profile maturity restrictions are as strong as Kids profile)
Standard profile maturity restrictions are UI-only filters, not server-side access controls

parentGuidance.recommendation: Parents should ONLY use the dedicated Kids profile type for young children, and enable Profile Lock (PIN) on ALL other profiles. Standard profile maturity restrictions provide surface-level filtering only and can be trivially bypassed via direct URLs.
criticalActions: Use the Kids profile type (not a standard profile with maturity restrictions) for children under 13
Enable Profile Lock (PIN) on EVERY non-kids profile to prevent Kids profile escape
Be aware that anyone with a direct Netflix link (shared via text, social media, etc.) can bypass maturity filters on standard profiles
